{"step_by_step_thinking": "R.P.D stands for Removable Partial Denture. The part of the R.P.D that opposes the action of the retainer during function is called reciprocation. Tripoding is a technique used in dentistry to stabilize a denture, but it doesn't oppose the action of the retainer. Retention is the ability of the denture to resist removal, not to oppose the action of the retainer. Stress breaking is a method used to distribute forces applied to the denture, but it doesn't oppose the action of the retainer.", "answer_choice": "B. Reciprocation"}
